they also held a ks3 cinema , a sponsored colour run , where runners get covered in bright colours , on the school field and merchandise and refreshment stalls collected even more donations .

documents.title: children in need : eastgate 'spot ' main chance to raise funds
text: last year 's children in need appeal raised a record-breaking £ 37m and everyone across the county has pulled out the stops to try and boost the fund this year .
eastgate academy held a spotacular event with everyone dressing up in their spottiest outfits for a donation !
the pupils and academy would like to say a big thank you to mr callaby who has made yet another showstopper cake for the raffle .
and £ 200 was raised for dressing in spots and the cake raffle raised £ 129.50 , making a grand total of £ 329.50 for children in need .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: widow 's 'heartbreak ' at pizza delivery man 's death
text: fawzia qasemi read a victim impact sentence to the court in which she said : `` the fact our baby wo n't be able to see him to hold his hand breaks my heart . ''
mr qasemi was a refugee who fled the war in afghanistan and the couple had two older sons aged seven and 11 .
mrs qasemi described him as the `` backbone '' of the family and added : `` i will never overcome the pain and hurt of losing him in such a tragic way . ''
she said her husband 's attackers were `` pure evil '' .
mrs qasemi watched lintott and lawson being sentenced over a video link from another room in cambridge crown court , because she was accompanied by her eight-week-old baby .
author: Emma Baugh
BBC Look East

documents.title: pizza driver 's killers 'robbed ' family of 'hard-working and much-loved man '
text: now back to the sentencing of two men from cambridgeshire and norfolk for killing a pizza delivery driver in peterborough .

when judge david farrell , sitting at cambridge crown court , jailed mark lintott and joel lawson , he said : `` neither of you showed an ounce of concern for the welfare of the man you had been party to knocking to the ground .
`` you both ate the pizzas , laughed and joked about what had just gone on . ''
he then told the killers the `` deliberately planned robbery '' had robbed a family `` of a hard-working and much-loved man '' .
author: Emma Baugh
BBC Look East

documents.title: children in need : academy puts 'specs ' on to spot the cash
text: children in need day is approaching its climax with a great entertainment programme promised on bbc1 this evening and people all over norfolk have taken on challenges to raise money to help disadvantaged young people .
nelson academy in downham market held a spectacular spotacular event , where everyone was asked to wear their most creative specs and spotty outfits , for a small donation !
the small boy in the front of the photograph above won the pudsey on a a square game .
the academy raised a fantastic £ 533.36 .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: suffolk to explore 'go-it-alone ' devolution deal
text: suffolk is to explore a `` go-it-alone '' devolution deal , despite disappointment over opposition in norfolk which has led to the current plan being scrapped .

jennie jenkins , conservative leader of babergh district council in south suffolk and chair of suffolk 's public sector leaders group , said : `` it was disappointing news to hear the results of the votes at king 's lynn & west norfolk borough council last night and it appears as though this means that there will not be an agreement reached for a norfolk and suffolk devolution deal at this time .

`` however , it is important for those of us in suffolk who wish to explore the potential opportunities for devolution further , to continue conversations with government and to meet as planned during the next seven days to vote on the commitment previously given to each respective authority in suffolk .
`` we will be seeking to explore the potential for a suffolk-based devolution deal and to investigate options for establishing interim governance arrangements for any such alternative deal . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: confirmed : 'devolution in present form off the table '
text: norfolk county council leader cliff jordan said : `` we understand the secretary of state will be writing to the norfolk and suffolk authorities to take the current devolution deal off the table .
`` it would be a waste of public money to bring members into the council unnecessarily on monday to debate a deal which is no longer available to us . ''
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: what would devolution have meant ?
text: the combined authority and its mayor would have been responsible for powers which would have been devolved from whitehall , but it was stressed there would be no intention for it to take existing powers from local authorities .
these powers were transport , strategic planning and skills training , with a hint that at some stage health and social care may be added to the list .
the mayor , who would be elected by voters and be answerable to a cabinet , would have been able to :

documents.title: breakingdevolution deal for norfolk and suffolk scrapped
text: i am hearing from reliable sources that the norfolk and suffolk devolution deal in its present form has been scrapped .

i am told that the local government secretary sajid javid has decided that the deal ca n't go ahead in its present form and as a result norfolk county council has cancelled monday 's meeting when councillors would have voted on the plan .
but suffolk is being told to continue with its meetings next week as ministers feel suffolk devolution on its own may work .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: alex neil : kyle lafferty is a 'cult hero ' with fans
text: norwich city manager alex neil has described striker kyle lafferty as a `` cult hero '' among fans .
lafferty scored a late equaliser against leeds united in city 's last outing two weeks ago , a game the canaries eventually lost 3-2 .
norwich travel to qpr tomorrow and neil has confirmed lafferty will be in the squad .
i 've got no issues with kyle whatsoever .
his relationship with the fans is a good healthy one , they want him to do well .
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: devolution : how did the idea develop ?
text: it was back in september 2015 that we were told the first steps had been taken towards devolution in the eastern region , with norfolk , suffolk and cambridgeshire councils all telling the government they wanted more of a say over local spending , planning and economic development .
throughout this year , there have been a number of developments :

documents.title: local government department quizzed on scrapping of devolution plans
text: we 've trying to confirm rumours that plans for devolution for norfolk and suffolk have been scrapped .
the department for communities and local government has said it is issuing a statement shortly .

documents.title: breakingnorfolk and suffolk devolution announcement expected shortly
text: the deal to devolve some spending powers to norfolk and suffolk and the election of a mayor in a new tier of local government is in doubt .
we are being told that an announcement is to be made shortly .

documents.title: defenders return to canaries squad for visit to qpr
text: the canaries are bolstering the squad with defenders for the visit to queen 's park rangers tomorrow after five games without a win .
portuguese right back ivo pinto is not going to be available , but steven whittaker will be in the squad as he 's made good progress from injury , norwich city manager alex neil said .
`` goalkeeper michael mcgovern and [ left back ] martin olsson fall into the same category .
both were precautionary , both are in the squad .
louis thompson [ midfielder ] is another one who is carrying a knock , hopefully he will be ok .
`` the break came at a good time .
we go into this game ready to turn it around .
we 've worked really hard this week .
the lads are in a good place , but they know that what we need now is a good performance and a good result .
`` kyle lafferty is in the squad for tomorrow 's game .
the fact that he came on and scored certainly puts him closer .
`` we have to defend as a team .
our intensity in first halves has been good , but in second halves it 's dropped . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: children 's services head admits not having skills to meet challenge
text: the outgoing head of norfolk 's children 's services claims he did not have the skills for the new improvements and challenges that ofsted had demanded in their latest report .

michael rosen has resigned as director and said : `` the immediate improvement priorities for children 's services need a director with a different skill set if the continuing challenges in that part of our service are to be addressed at the pace norfolk 's children deserve .
`` the urgency with which these challenges need resolving has led to my decision to create space for a new director to be brought in as soon as possible . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: ali qasemi : the 'devoted husband ' killed for the price of three pizzas
text: ali qasemi 's wife fawzia was pregnant with their third child when he was killed .
the 45-year-old was delivering three pizzas costing just over £ 50 when he was attacked .
speaking after last month 's trial , det insp lucy thomson , from cambridgeshire police , described it as a `` sickening , senseless crime '' that had `` devastated '' the qasemi family .
`` they have lost a loving , devoted husband and father , devastating their close-knit family , all for the price of three pizzas , '' she said .
following mr qasemi 's death , his employer pizza hut uk said it had reviewed its training methods for drivers .
author: Emma Baugh
BBC Look East

documents.title: breakingpair jailed for killing driver for pizzas
text: two men who killed a takeaway delivery driver in a `` snatch and grab '' robbery for three pizzas have been jailed .
pizza hut worker ali qasemi , 45 , died in may , two days after he was punched and left dying on the pavement in peterborough .
mark lintott ( left ) , 29 , of peterborough , who was found guilty of robbery and manslaughter at a trial last month , was jailed for 13 years at cambridge crown court .
joel lawson ( right ) , 25 , of norwich , who earlier admitted both charges , was jailed for nine years .
during lintott 's trial in peterborough , the court heard he and lawson had been drinking with friends when they came up with their plan to take the food from the driver without paying .
author: Emma Baugh
BBC Look East

documents.title: improvements to children 's services 'too slow ' for ofsted inspectors
text: last month , ofsted inspectors pointed to ways norfolk 's children 's services should improve further after finding they were not yet consistently `` good enough '' across the board and the overall pace of improvement remained slow .
in a letter the inspectors highlighted the `` robust '' initial response to child protection issues .
they also welcomed strengthened and effective arrangements for managing risks to children who go missing or are at risk of sexual exploitation .
they also noted care leavers services were starting to deliver better outcomes .
but they still maintained the department was `` inadequate '' and slow to implement change .
the director of the norfolk county council department , michael rosen , has now resigned .

chairman of the children 's services committee roger smith said : `` michael has made an important contribution to strengthening children 's services which has made a notable difference to the lives of vulnerable children . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: 'desire for a change in our approach ' as children 's services boss leaves post
text: the council officer who has headed norfolk 's children 's services for nearly 18 months has quit and is `` moving on from his role '' .
michael rosen ( joined norfolk county council as an interim assistant director for early help in 2013 and became the director in september 2015 .
speaking of his decision to leave the authority today , he said : `` children 's services in norfolk has come a long way and is a very different service from when i started .
`` i 'm pleased that inspectors have seen improvement in all the areas they [ ofsted ] reviewed , but there is still more to do and members have indicated a desire for a change in our approach . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: ex-minister lamb told that children 's service head was leaving county council
text: norman lamb ( the former care minister and north norfolk mp , has told me he 's had a conversation with the council 's managing director wendy thompson .
he said she told him mr rosen is leaving his post , and that an interim head of children 's services - who is experienced - will be appointed .
the county council press office said they would issue a statement later today .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: head of children 's services was 'under pressure ' to resign
text: i understand that the head of the county 's children 's services has quit .
michael rosen came under pressure after an ofsted report said his norfolk county council department was still inadequate , and slow to implement change .
i heard last night that michael rosen was under pressure to resign , and this morning i rang him to ask what his position was .
he told me at that time he was in a meeting and could n't discuss anything yet .
i 've also spoken to the council leader cliff jordan and he confirmed that mr rosen has quit .
the county council 's press office has n't confirmed the situation , but has said mr rosen has n't been sacked .
i hope to get more to you later when the county council issues a statement .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: breakinghead of under-fire children 's services quits
text: the head of norfolk 's children 's services has quit , according to the leader of the county council .
council officer michael rosen came under pressure after an ofsted report said the department was still inadequate , and slow to implement change .
council leader cliff jordan has revealed today that mr rosen has quit .

documents.title: man and woman arrested on sus of murder
text: a man in his 50s and a woman in her 40s have been arrested on sus of murder in connection with the death of michael currer in norwich on 12 november .
mr currer , 59 , known as mick to his friends and family , was found dead at his home address in saffron square .
a home office post-mortem examination concluded he died as a result of severe chest and facial injuries sustained from an assault .
the two people in custody and being questioned are from the norwich area , police said .

documents.title: plan asks people to take more responsibility for their own health
text: more people in norfolk and north suffolk are likely to be treated away from hospitals in future as the local nhs grapples with a predicted shortfall in funding of £ 415m by 2021 .

dr wendy thomson chairs the norfolk and waveney sustainability and transformation plan ( stp ) which represents clinical commissioning groups , councils , hospitals , healthcare organisations and the ambulance service .
she said something has to be done to balance the `` system '' .
`` our population is growing , people are generally living longer and the type of care that people need is changing , '' she said .
`` we know that there are ways we can improve how we care for people , and that our current services are not sustainable if they continue as they are now . ''
people will be asked to take increasing responsibility for their own health and more care will be carried out in communities .
if this can be achieved , it is estimated that one in five people , who would otherwise have needed to be in a hospital bed , could be helped at home , members said
local people and organisations are being invited to comment on the plan .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: canaries defenders warned by new qpr manager
text: norwich city 's beleaguered defence resume their championship campaign at qpr tomorrow .
the canaries went into the two week international break on a run of five matches without a win.. only two sides in the division have conceded more goals than city this season .
qpr will have ian holloway back in charge for the first time since he left the club in 2006 .
he 's promising to bring an attacking style of play to loftus road `` my blackpool team had three up front and we had a mindset of we were going to outscore the opposition . ''

documents.title: strictly 'star ' ed takes time out to talk about his gangnam routine
text: ed balls talked about how he danced his way into strictly come dancing fans ' hearts with his gangnam style routine after he joined in the festive spirit last night turning on the christmas lights in his home city - norwich .
the norwich city fc chairman took time out on his way to blackpool to perform the festive honour on the steps of city hall .
he treated the crowd to a fleeting section from his now infamous gangnam routine .
the strictly come dancing contender was rushing to the lancashire seaside town to perform his next routine for the show at the famous tower ballroom , but was overjoyed to be in norwich first .
author: Martin Barber
BBC News

documents.title: council leader says 'elected mayor ' idea stalling devolution
text: the leader of king 's lynn & west norfolk borough council said he was disappointed at his authority 's rejection of the devolution deal for norfolk and suffolk , but he could understand why it was not backed .
`` there were reservations right actoss the chamber about what this deal would involve '' said councillor brian long ( conservative ) .
`` whilst many councillors could see that there was a need for improvement of infrastructure in west norfolk the insistence by the government on a mayor was the straw that broke the camel 's back .
`` i hope there will be another deal which can be done , but possibly one that does not involve an elected mayor . ''
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: concern over elected mayor scuppers devolution plans in east
text: plans for a devolution of some spending powers from central government to norfolk and suffolk are in doubt this morning after councillors at king 's lynn & west norfolk overwhelmingly said `` no '' to an elected mayor by 44 votes to 14 .
everyone thought this would be a close vote , but as speaker after speaker lined up to condemn the plans it was clear that a lot of people had serious reservations .

many objected to the idea of having one elected mayor covering both counties , questioned the cost of devolution and were concerned that if king 's lynn became part of a larger authority it might be forgotten .
under the plans norfolk and suffolk would have been given extra powers and money , but every individual district and county council had to agree to the scheme .
claims by supporters of devolution that it would speed up important projects like the upgrade of the ely rail junction and provide more money for new homes did not seem to win everyone round .
last night broadland and south norfolk overwhelmingly voted 'yes ' but the decisive vote from king 's lynn means devolution in its present form must surely now be dead .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: live court : 14-year-old fined for arson
text: the case of a 14-year-old boy who admitted starting a fire which caused thousands of pounds worth of damage has come before norwich magistrates ' court for sentencing .

the boy , from norwich , who can not be named for legal reasons , destroyed in an arson attack a stack of hay bales and a chicken shed at church farm , long stratton , belonging to andrew leeder at the end of march this year .
the court which is sitting as a youth court , heard the value of the chicken shed was about £ 9,600 with a total loss of over £ 10,000 .
the boy pleaded guilty to arson in august .

chris brown , representing the boy , says the 14-year-old is `` deeply ashamed of his actions '' , adding `` you are dealing with a decent family with a decent young man who has done something incredibly stupid '' .
the boy told the court he was `` sorry for what i have done i will stay out of trouble '' .
he was given a nine month referral order and told he must work the a youth offending team and norfolk fire service .
he must pay £ 580 compensation for the straw bails .
magistrates said he had clearly shown remorse .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: world prematurity day marked by special exhibition at rosie
text: the rosie neonatal intensive care unit ( nicu ) in cambridge is holding a photography exhibition of its 'graduate ' babies born prematurely .
the event is to mark world prematurity day .
families have been invited to a tea party to see their on display and meet some of the key people that cared for them .
one of those graduates will be paralympic cyclist , louis rolfe , who will be attending with his sister who was also born early .
on average , about 77 babies are born prematurely in the east every week .
most receive care at one of three specialist neo-natal centres in cambridge , luton and norwich .

BBC News

documents.title: devolution : decision time for two counties
text: after months of meetings and arguments it 's decision time .
tonight three of the twelve councils in norfolk and suffolk , which are still in the process , will decide whether or not to proceed with the devolution idea .
district councillors in broadland , south norfolk and kings lynn & west norfolk will meet this evening , while norfolk county council will meet on monday .
if they and the eight councils in suffolk all say yes , it will mark the start of a major shake up in how local services are provided and local decisions made .
if any of them say no , the whole thing is off .
this has been a very divisive issue in norfolk .
both sides of the argument will be nervously watching watch happens .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

text: the justice secretary liz truss has warned that it will `` take time '' to bring stability to prisons in england and wales .
on sunday , 6 november 230 inmates at bedford prison started a riot after they got out of their cells , seized keys , broke into medicine stores and started small fires .

ms truss is due to meet members of the prison officers association to discuss their concerns , as photos were posted on social media of inmates at a jail near shaftesbury apparently taking drugs and drinking alcohol .

documents.title: 'i 'm lucky to be alive ' says young motorist
text: thomas sneddon says he 's lucky to be alive .
the 18-year-old spent 10 days in hospital , with a collapsed lung , broken collar bone and 15 fractures following a car accident in july - the scars are visible on his face .

he 's been chosen to spearhead a new road safety campaign launched by norfolk 's police and crime commissioner this week , and today thomas spoke to students at norwich city college about the dangers of driving .
thomas admits he was driving too fast for wet conditions when he came off the b1145 between aylsham and cawston .
his renault clio swung out , hit a tree and `` slammed into the ground , bounced around a few more trees and then a tree came down on top '' .
he was conscious throughout , dialling 999 for the police as he says he did n't think the accident was too serious at the time .
`` before i knew it , i had three fire engines , an ambulance and two police cars it took two hours to cut me out and only then did i hear what injuries i 'd sustained '' .
the accident was , says thomas , in the `` middle of nowhere '' , and it was pitch black .
his headlights had fallen out on impact and emergency services found him by the phone light on his torch .
as an ambassador for the road safety campaign , thomas says he does n't want anyone else - or their families or friends - to go through what he went through .
his message to young drivers is `` think of the what if 's if it 's wet , or if there 's ice there 's no point in taking any risks it 's better to turn up late than not at all . ''
as a young driver you 're not as good as you think you are - you 're very inexperienced if they had n't found me that night i 'd have probably died . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: how to become a magistrate
text: if you 're thinking of becoming a magistrate , here 's a quick guide to what 's needed from the government 's citizenship website :
not everyone is legible to apply though , especially if the following applies to you :
some jobs also present a conflict of interest , such as being a police officer .
no formal qualifications or legal training are needed .
the work is unpaid , and you will need to be in court for at least 13 days , or 26 half-days a year .

documents.title: the role of a magistrate
text: all criminal cases begin in a magistrates ' court , where they are usually heard by three magistrates including one who 's trained to act as chairperson .
they deal with crimes such as minor assaults , motoring offences , theft and handling stolen goods .
the most serious crimes , like murder , rape and robbery , are passed to the crown courts .
a magistrate makes the decision on whether a defendant should be kept in custody , or let out on strict conditions .
they can also give punishments , including fines , unpaid work in the community and prison terms of up to six months , rising to up to 12 months if it 's for more than one crime .
some civil and family cases can be heard by a magistrate , including child custody and adoption , taking children into care , unpaid council tax and tv licence evasion .
only experienced magistrates who 've had special training can hear family cases .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: looking at our justice system
text: a bbc investigation into courts data last year revealed a warning from magistrates that the criminal justice system was `` on the cusp '' of breaking down amid growing delays , court closures and funding cuts .
one year on , and the average time taken to complete magistrate cases in england has risen 6 % from 151 to 159 days .
the ministry of justice says £ 1bn is being spent on improving courts .

its figures show that while there has a been a small increase in the average time courts take to deal with cases , the amount of time between a defendant being charged and being listed for court has risen by two days .
today we 'll have a reporter in norwich magistrates ' court , giving us an insight into our justice system .

documents.title: festival celebrating norwich 's medieval churches wins lotto cash
text: a festival celebrating norwich 's medieval churches has been awarded thousands of pounds by the heritage lottery fund .
the norwich historic churches trust ( nhct ) has been given £ 68,000 to develop 'flintspiration ' , a weekend-long festival to be held on the first may bank holiday .

neil blunt , of flintspiration and nhct , said : `` today norwich has more medieval churches than any other city north of the alps , an exceptional legacy and outstanding setting for the festival . ''
a range of local bodies including the university of east anglia , norwich city council and the county 's museums service are partnering the project .
in 1967 the diocese of norwich decided that only eight of the 31 medieval churches were needed for worship , leaving the remainder at risk of demolition .
the nhct was set up in 1973 to care for most of the unused buildings , some of which are serving as arts centres and theatres .

documents.title: great ryburgh dig finds 81 'rare ' anglo-saxon coffins
text: here are more images and details about a very rare ancient christian burial site uncovered in the county .

archaeologists carrying out excavations since january have discovered 81 `` extremely rare '' tree-trunk coffins at the `` previously unknown '' early christian anglo-saxon community 's cemetery , at great ryburgh .
their remarkable preservation was due to the waterlogged conditions of the river valley .
historic england believes the burials date from between the 7th and 9th centuries ad and were `` the final resting place for a community of early christians '' .
research is continuing to find out where the bodies came from , how they were related and what their diet and health was like .
some of the finds will go on display at norwich castle museum .

documents.title: rare saxon burial site is england 's most well-preserved
text: more now on that major archaeological find in norfolk .
archaeologists say 81 anglo saxon wooden coffins found at a burial site near fakenham are the most well-preserved to be unearthed in england .
they believe watery conditions protected the bodies , which date back to the 7th century .
the unique graves , lined with planks , were first unearthed in a field in great ryburgh in 2014 by landowner gary boyce , who was putting in a lake to help control flooding .
he says they 've been developing their farm for 13 years as a holiday let as well as carrying out various conservation programmes .
the excavation has delayed plans but mr boyce , who 's `` had to remortgage '' , says `` we 've done the right thing '' .

local archaeologist matthew champion , who made the discovery , described mr boyce as a true local hero whose role in the excavation has been significant `` despite massive financial cost to himself '' .
`` very , very little is known about this period when anglo saxons were just becoming christians , '' he said .
`` this will provide a real snapshot of what was going on in that period . ''

documents.title: applegate loses top-level swimming funding
text: norfolk paralympic gold medalist jessica-jane applegate has been told that she 'll be getting less backing from british swimming in 2017 .
the 20-year old won three medals , two silvers a bronze , at the paralym in rio but did n't meet the criteria needed to stay in the elite 'podium squad ' .
instead she 'll be part of the 'podium potential ' squad .
it means less funding and reduced access to training camps for the belton swimmer .
four gold medallists from rio sascha kindred , susie rodgers , stephanie millward and relay winner claire cashmore have been omitted from the list altogether .
author: Phil Daley

documents.title: ofsted into children 's services expected to show some improvement
text: an oftsed report to be published this morning is expected to say improvements have been made but that there 's still work to do within norfolk 's children 's services department .
the department presently has a rating of inadequate , and it 's thought the report will show improvements but criticise the lack of ruthlessness among managers .
roger smith , chair of norfolk 's children 's services committee , said social workers need more recognition for what they do .
`` what really concerns me is the lack of encouragement both in the media and in the public for the valued work our social workers do , '' he said .
`` they almost do the work that firemen do .
the work all hours , they put their lives in danger , they deal with very difficult circumstances and they rescue families . ''

text: good morning , it 's positively balmy out there !
well , maybe a bit on the grey side but the temperature is certainly a warm 12c , that 's 54f in old money .

more on the report as soon as we get it .

documents.title: new mental health beds for children lie empty as funding not available
text: a number of mental health beds at the dragonfly unit at carlton court , built in oulton broad for children and teenagers at a cost of almost £ 1m , are lying empty because nhs england says it has n't decided if it can fund them .

the capital spend for the building was funded by the norfolk and suffolk nhs foundation trust to increase the number of beds for children and teenagers and decrease the numbers having to be sent hundreds of miles away from their families .

sarah barrett , 19 , from southwold , was sent to southampton in 2014 , after attempting to take her own life : `` it was n't really until the day before i had to leave that i was like 'this is a long way away ' and then when i was in hospital , mum said she could n't come down and see me one weekend because she just could n't get there , it was just too far away and she could n't afford it . ''
nhs england says it wo n't change its funding for staff until a review is completed - some time before march 2018 .
author: Nikki Fox
BBC Look East

documents.title: video : coach crashes on to roundabout
text: a coach had to be winched off a roundabout following a crash last night .
the 33-seat vehicle was empty when it crashed on to the roundabout near caister .
police were called to the scene at about 19:30 during recovery , causing minor disruption to traffic .
the driver of the coach was unhurt , and is helping police with their inquires .
author: Andrew Turner

documents.title: pensioner on trial for sex offences against children
text: a man from sprowston has gone on trial charged with more than 30 sex offences dating back to the 1970s .
colin waterfield , 70 , of stonehouse road , is charged with 32 alleged offences involving 10 children between 1973 and 1995 , and animal pornography at a later date .
the allegations include indecent assault on a young old boy in the mid 1970s , and the alleged rape of a girl aged under 16 two years later .
other men and woman also allege to be victims of mr waterfield when they were children .
at norwich crown court today , the prosecution has been outlining the details of the charges to the jury , and has heard from the first witness .

in a video interview with police , a woman said mr waterfield invited children to his house from a local children 's home , adding he used to video them in his front garden after telling them to undress .
mr waterfield denies all charges .
the case is expected to last for at least four weeks .

documents.title: axing crossing patrols 'puts children in danger '
text: members of norfolk county council are among those calling for the authority to rethink pressing ahead with scrapping some crossings patrolled by lollipop men and women .
ukip councillor jonathon childs says the council has a responsibility to keep young people safe .
every child matters , in rural districts , cities and towns we 're there to look after children , not potentially put them in danger . ''

documents.title: council to consult on plans to axe lollipop patrols
text: plans to close about 40 crossings patrolled by lollipop men and women in norfolk are pressing ahead .
county councillors have voted to begin a consultation on getting rid of patrols on crossings that are not considered dangerous enough under national guidelines .
the cuts would save the council £ 100,000 a year .
one on colman road , norwich , could be lost .
councillor bert bremner says that would be wrong .

it 's a three-way crossing we want children to walk to school yet they 're making sure they ca n't get there ; they are taking away the one protective thing they 've got - the crossing patrol person it 's appalling . ''
author: Tom Baker
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: mental health trust falling short on patient care
text: the norfolk and suffolk nhs foundation trust has been named by regulators as one of the four worst performing trusts for caring for patients with mental health problems .
the other three trusts have been named as the isle of wight nhs trust , west london mental health nhs trust and coventry and warwickshire partnership nhs trust .
a survey of 13,000 service users across the country showed the trusts to be peforming `` significantly worse '' than others .
the care quality commission 's deputy chief inspector of hospitals , paul lelliott , has written to the four trusts outlining the action they must take to improve .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lottery funding for new village hall
text: a north norfolk village has secured funding to replace its village hall .
trimingham , near cromer , has been given £ 425,000 from the big lottery fund , and combined with other funding it means work can start next spring .
its existing hall was built in the 1930s , but is close to rapidly eroding cliffs .
terry brown , chairman of the parish council , said the hall was regularly used to provide lunches for the elderly , but spaces were limited .
a new village hall will allow it to expand numbers , helping to reduce isolation and loneliness .
he hopes the old building will still be put to some use :
it 's an iconic building and we 'd like to see it turned into some sort of heritage centre , community shop or cafe , as we have the coastal path through the village . ''

documents.title: final nudge takes fakenham feature
text: one of the most valuable races of the year at fakenham has been won by a horse called final nudge this afternoon .
the 6/5 favourite took the first prize of almost £ 8,000 in the weatherbys racing diaries beginners chase , with jockey ap heskin on board by a neck from join the clan .
80/1 shot the jugopolist came third , but only four horses started the race .
it was the fourth of six races on the card at fakenham today .
brilliant ride by @ twitterid to foil gamble and make it 1 win from 1 ride at @ twitterid # finalnudge

BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: how many bones does a diplodocus skeleton have ?
text: earlier this year the natural history museum announced its decision to retire dippy the diplodocus in 2017 , replacing him with the skeleton of a blue whale .
the plaster-cast skeleton is one of 10 replicas of the dinosaur in museums around the world .
the dinosaur 's head originally pointed downwards , with the tail resting on the ground .
during world war two , the skeleton was disassembled and moved to the basement to protect it from bomb damage .
in 1979 , the london museum moved dippy to hintze hall where he 's remained ever since .
his last day on show will be 4 january 2017 .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: murder victim named
text: a man found murdered at a property in the mile cross area of norwich at the weekend has been named by police .
michael currer , known as mick to friends and family , was found dead at his home in saffron square on 12 november .
a post-mortem examination concluded that 59-year-old mr currer died as a result of severe chest and facial injuries sustained from an assault .
the property remains cordoned off , and police inquiries continue .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: murder charge following police investigation
text: a 19-year-old man has been charged in connection with the murder of a man at a property in norwich earlier this month .
hassiem baqir , from the london area , was charged today .
steve stannard , 37 , received fatal stab wounds in bowers avenue , in the mile cross area , on 5 november .
mr baqir has been remanded in custody and will appear before norwich magistrates tomorrow .

text: tom o'brien has won the first two races at fakenham this afternoon .
he took the opener on board the 7/2 shot taroum and then followed it up 15/8 favourite queen spud in the second of the six races on the card today .
one of the most valuable races of the year at fakenham takes place at 14:35 with almost £ 8,000 in prize money going to the winner of the weatherbys racing diaries beginners ' chase .

documents.title: talktalk hack was 'significant and sustained '
text: the teenager who admits seven hacking offences linked to the talktalk data breach will be sentenced on december 13 .
the telecoms giant talktalk fell victim to what it described as a `` significant and sustained '' attack on its website on october 21 , 2015 .
the attack resulted in the personal data of nearly 160,000 people being accessed and was branded a `` car crash '' earlier this year by then information commissioner christopher graham .

documents.title: teenager admits talktalk hack
text: a teenager has admitted seven charges under the computer misuse act against telecoms company talktalk .
the 17-year-old , who can not be named for legal reasons , appeared at norwich youth court .
metropolitan police officers went to his address on 3 november last year and seized computers and other devices .
the court was told he had used hacking tool software to identify vulnerabilities on target websites
we 'll have more shortly .

documents.title: agreement over school 's future 'to be reached soon '
text: the future of great yarmouth high school has been raised at a norfolk county council meeting this morning .
the school is in special measures , and a deadlock over the lease is holding up its conversion to an academy .
the inspiration trust has been asking for a 125-year lease , but the great yarmouth grammar school foundation , which owns the land , has offered a shorter lease .
throughout the debate to resolve the deadlock , it 's been said the school could be closed down if the inspiration trust withdraws .

councillor jonathan childs ( ukip ) told today 's children 's services meeting that his `` inbox is full of comments from concerned parents of the 850 children at the school '' and the situation must be resolved .
the council 's assistant director of education , chris snudden , said she had spoken to both sides and `` was confident an agreement would be reached in the next few days '' .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: dippy to drop in on norwich
text: norwich cathedral will be dippy the diplodocus ' last port of call on his tour of the uk .
the famous 21m ( 22 yds ) plaster-cast skeleton will easily fit into the 77m ( 84 yds ) nave , with plenty of space to spare .
the cathedral will remove the chairs to allow worshippers and visitors space to admire the awesome size of the creature .

dean of the cathedral , the very revd jane hedges , says dippy 's presence will stimulate `` questions and debate about creations and the origins of life '' , adding : `` we hope dippy will be a source of enjoyment and a fun experience to attract people of all ages to come to the cathedral . ''
the replica dinosaur was cast from original fossil bones discovered in the us in 1898 .
he came to the natural history museum in 1905 , and was moved to the central hall in 1979 .
his last day on show will be 4 january 2017 , before he works his way around the uk .
dippy will spend at least four to six months at each of the eight carefully selected venues , and will need to be taken apart and reconstructed at every stop of his tour .
he is due in norwich from july to october 2020 .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pedestrian seriously injured in road collision
text: a woman suffered life-threatening injuries in a collision with a vehicle in norwich yesterday .
a ford transit tipper truck was in collision with the pedestrian on the inner ring road , barn road , outside norwich bathroom and kitchens at about 09:00 .
the woman , in her 50s , was taken to the norfolk and norwich university hospital where she remains in a critical condition .
norfolk police are appealing for any witnesses to contact them .

documents.title: superstar heading to norwich
text: he 's big , he 's old and he 's famous - and this ancient celebrity has norwich in his sights .
dippy the diplodocus has dominated the national history museum 's hintze hall since 1979 , but his days of enthralling thousands of visitors are drawing to an end .
the plaster-cast replica is being retired , and like many superstars he 'll be embarking on a tour of carefully selected venues across the uk .
the reconstructed skeleton will start his journey in britain 's fossil-rich jurassic coast , at dorset in early 2018 , followed by six other locations .
his uk-wide tour will then end its days in norwich , in the nave of norwich cathedral in 2020 .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: protest action by prison officers
text: thousands of prison officers nationwide are stopping work today in protest over health and safety concerns .
here in norwich , about 40 members of the prison officers association ( poa ) are taking part in the day of protest .
they stopped work at midnight , and will continue with their protest action until midnight tonight , unless instructed otherwise .
the jail is being run by non-union members and the management team .
poa branch secretary steve searby told me that prison officers across the country have been cut `` in the region of 6,000 and it 's all about money we do not have enough troops on the ground '' .

here at norwich we 're a lot better off staff-wise that a lot of jails across the country - however , we are still running a normal regime day-in and day-out with minus 15 staff to work the prison safely . ''
author: Wally Webb
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: headteacher says crossing patrol is vital to school
text: norfolk county council has identified 38 out of 96 school crossing patrols that it says could be cut in a bid to save £ 100,000 a year .
one of those under threat is on homefield avenue in bradwell , close to homefield primary school .
headteacher bradley young says the road is really busy , especially at peak times , .
and `` without our crossing patrol officer it would be a nightmare '' .
what price , he says , can you put on a child 's safety ?
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: parents ' concerns at proposed cuts to crossing patrols
text: lollipop men and women across the county could lose their jobs if county councillors approve plans to cut crossing patrols in a bid to save money .
i 've been speaking to parents at moorlands primary academy in belton , who are concerned the proposed cuts will put children at risk .
one mother told me that motorists do n't keep to the 20mph speed limit , up speed through the village and that by the time they get near the school `` they 're doing quite a lick '' .

this father agreed with her , saying motorists come round the bend `` doing 50-60mph it 's as if no-one 's here they think it 's fun '' , adding that he 'd `` hate it to be on the council 's conscience '' if a child gets hurt .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: lollipop patrols could be axed
text: more than a third of the county 's school crossings patrolled by lollipop men and women could be cut to save money .
norfolk county council is looking at closing 38 of the 96 crossings , which will save around £ 100,000 a year .
it says only those crossings that are n't dangerous enough to meet national guidelines would be taken away .
it will be discussing the proposals today .
if they 're accepted , they will be put out to public consultation .

documents.title: rail station evacuated
text: commuters at norwich train station were evacuated within the last hour because of a fire alarm .
greater anglia has confirmed to bbc radio norfolk that it was a false alarm .
the incident was resolved very quickly .
the station is open and there have been no knock-on effects to services .
author: Nanette Aldous
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: webster thrashes phil taylor at grand slam of darts
text: norwich darts star darren webster caused a shock at the grand slam of darts tournament in wolverhampton last night .
the 'demolition man ' thrashed the 16-time world champion phil 'the power ' taylor 5-0 .
not such good news for nathan derry from gorleston : he lost 5-0 to the bdo 's number one player glen durrant .

documents.title: park assault teen remanded in custody
text: a teenager has appeared before norwich magistrates court on charges in connection with an incident in norwich on friday , 11 november .
a 16-year-old boy suffered a fracture eye socket , and 15-year-old mo vadillo ( suffered wounds to his arm , hands and ear in the incident in chapelfield gardens shortly before 19:30 .
tyler tomkinson , 18 , of devonshire street , norwich , has been charged with two counts of grievous bodily harm .
he 's been remanded in custody and will appear at norwich crown court on 12 december .

documents.title: video : strictly 's ed 's 'thrusting ' takes him to blackpool
text: he 's done it - norwich city chairman ed balls ' thrusting and pony dancing in saturday night 's strictly come dancing has won him a place on the show 's annual trip to blackpool 's tower ballroom .
head judge led goodman said their were `` no words in the dictionary '' to describe the former shadow chancellor 's dance to gangnam style by psy .
for once , craig revel-horwood was nearly speechless , only managing `` omg '' .
want to see it again ?

documents.title: how to get the best photo of the 'supermoon ' - according to nasa
text: if there happens to be a break in the cloud where you live tonight , you might want to photograph the `` supermoon '' which wo n't be this close to earth again until november 2034 .
nasa has issued some top tips on taking a memorable image , which include :
we 're also told that if you 're prepared to wait until tuesday , weather conditions should be better , although the moon wo n't be at its biggest size .

documents.title: best foot forward for nick 's pudsey challenge
text: he 's facing mud , marshes , sea , sand and shingle - but bbc radio norfolk 's nick conrad wo n't be deterred .
today , nick set off on his bbc children in need challenge - to run 45 miles along the coastal path in four days , and raise £ 10,000 for the charity .
nick and trainer/running partner neil featherby set off from hunstanton shortly after 10:00 , through holme dunes towards titchwell , arriving in brancaster just before 13:00 .
the terrain was n't always easy - recent rain and drizzle had made the boardwalks slippery and at times the running duo had to walk .
tomorrow the pair will run 11 miles from brancaster to wells .
on wednesday , they face a 13-mile journey from wells to cley .
the fourth and final day is their hardest challenge - another half marathon from cley , ending up at cromer pier .

cley shingle bank will be tough and although it 's uplifting to go through my home town of sheringham , there 's the hill beforehand , and a huge elevation through the cliffs the other side of the town and another hill in the form of beeston bump before cromer . ''

documents.title: fisherman tells of his shock at discovering body
text: there are believed to be no sus circumstances about the death of a man whose body was found on a beach at great yarmouth earlier today .
it was discovered by fisherman aaron thurlow , who told me he 'd just finishing fishing and was hauling in his nets ready to shore them out again when he noticed something in the breakers .
`` it was only just getting light so i could n't make it out so went closer and closer , then it became apparent it was a body .
there was a fisherman to the north of it , fishing , and not knowing there was a body there . ''
it was a shock , added mr thurlow : `` it 's hard to say how long it had been in the water , but unfortunately it was too late to try resuscitation . ''
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: man indicates he will deny charge of murdering toddler in 1968
text: a pensioner is expected to deny murdering an 18-month-old boy almost 50 years ago when he appears in court later this week .
david dearlove , 70 , from great yarmouth is charged with the murder of paul booth from haverton hill , stockton-on-tees , in 1968 .
mr dearlove , who wore a black t-shirt and had grey hair in a side parting , appeared before teesside magistrate 's court , middlesbrough , for a two minute hearing this afternoon .
no pleas were entered and he made no application for bail .
he was remanded in custody to appear at teesside crown court on wednesday .
the defendant faces one charge of murder on 1 october , 1968 and one of neglect between january and october 1968 .
adam hodge , defending , said an application for bail will be made in future and added : `` i can say that the matters are denied .
there will be a trial . ''
magistrates had applied a restriction reporting the dead child 's identify , but it was lifted following a challenge by the press .

documents.title: man charged with beccles armed robbery
text: a man is due to appear at ipswich crown court next month , after being charged in connection with an armed robbery at a jewellers in beccles in september .
the 24-year-old , formerly of york road in great yarmouth , was charged with robbery and possession of an imitation firearm whilst committing robbery , as well as possession of cannabis .

documents.title: can you speak `` woof '' ?
text: norfolk live has a `` paw-some '' rival - the barking bugle - tagged `` woofing from norfolk '' .
if you can speak `` dog '' then this could be the site for you .
edited by frodo , a king charles spaniel , it has the latest stories for four-legged hounds and even a what 's on guide for tail-waggers to plan their weekends .

the `` mutt '' -ley team of newshounds includes science reporter lilly - a rough coat jack russell - who has the latest updates on medical issues , so your pet pooch can alert you to any signs of illness that might mean a trip to the vet .
the canny-canines took time away from sniffing out a good story , to `` talk '' to bbc radio norfolk 's nick conrad earlier .

with followers from as far afield as austrlia , peru and america , frodo - with their help of his secretarial assistant and translator amanda brophy - explained that he had hoped to stand as a canine candidate in the us elections , but work commitments meant he missed the deadline .
good luck frodo , there 's always next time .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bracing way to dust off the christmas cobwebs
text: what better way to burn off the christmas calories than a boxing day swim ?
the cromer `` dip '' begins with a time-challenged fun run at 10:30 followed by a countdown at 11:00 to see who can be the first into the water .
the tide will be out this year , so there 'll be plenty of beach to run across near the pier .
the `` double dip '' event will see the swimmers run in to sea , splash about and then go back in .
more than 250 brave participants are expected , many in fancy dress - the only rules are no wet suits , and everyone must be seen to get their hair wet .
it 's all in aid of charity , wlth more than £ 2,300 raised last year .
this year 's beneficiary is the town 's rnli , in memory of long-term `` dipper '' tony west ( seen below ) who lost his battle with cancer recently .
the rnli has been a long-term supporter of the boxing day dip , providing a boat on standby for swimmers .
do n't forget to send us a photo if you 're there !

documents.title: murders being treated as separate incidents
text: police are carrying extra patrols in an area of norwich while inquiries continue into two separate murders .
the body of a man in his 50s was found by officers called to a property in saffron square , mile cross , at 07:00 on saturday .
the previous weekend , a 37-year-old man died as the result of a stab wound at a property in bowers avenue .
the addresses are less than a mile apart .
the incidents are being treated as separate murder investigations , although officers are keeping an open mind .

supt lynne cross says it 's `` unusual to have two incidents of this nature in such a short space of time '' and they understand residents will be `` shocked and concerned that there have been two separate murders within a week '' .
we are carrying out additional patrols in those areas where residents may have concerns and our officers will be happen to answer any questions . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: the latest weather : mild , with light rain
text: the rest of the day is expected to be mild with outbreaks of light rain .
temperatures will reach 11c ( 52f ) , and it 'll be breezy in coastal areas .
the grey weather has kept visitors away from cromer beach , as seen in this photo taken a short while ago by bbc weather watcher hopping frog .

documents.title: pccs discuss joint projects
text: the police and crime commissioners ( pcc ) for norfolk and suffolk have met to discuss further collaboration between the two constabularies .
it was the first time norfolk 's lorne green and suffolk 's tim passmore , along with chief constables simon bailey and gareth wilson , have met since the pcc elections in may .
discussions focussed on their commitment to improve victim support , and heard how their commitment to the victims ' code was working .
norfolk and suffolk `` are on a journey together '' , says mr green , wtih the next meeting in a few months ' time .

mr passmore says the collaboration between the two forces is `` back on track '' and the `` joint working in protective services is having a beneficial effect for people and businesses in both counties '' .
i know lorne and myself are committed to developing new areas of work on a joint basis such as the new project in body worn videos which will be delivered in june of next year . ''

documents.title: breakingman charged over baby death nearly 50 years ago
text: a 70-year-old man has been charged with murder following the death of an 18-month-old boy almost 50 years ago .
cleveland police said the toddler , from the haverton hill area of stockton , died on 1 october 1968 .
officers said the man who has been charged is from the great yarmouth area of norfolk .

documents.title: body discovered on beach
text: the body of a man has been found on a beach in great yarmouth .
a fisherman , who 'd been on the sand by salisbury road throughout the night , discovered the body just before 07:00 .
police officers who went to the scene say they are treating the death of the man as `` unexplained '' .
a police spokesman has told me they do n't believe there are any sus circumstances .
the man has been identified , and the police are in the process of contacting his family .
no further details are being released as yet .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: men charged after lead theft cases at two village churches
text: three men have been charged in connection with lead thefts in the county .
it follows incidents at st peter 's church in ringland ( on 3 november and all saints church in scottow on 10 november .
the three men , who are all from london and aged between 21 and 30 , have been charged with theft and attempted theft .

documents.title: breakingcanaries goalkeeper back home after international duty injury
text: norwich city 's michael mcgovern is back at the club after suffering an injury while on international duty with northern ireland .
the goalkeeper has started the canaries ' last 14 championship matches , but has been ruled out of tomorrow night 's friendly against croatia .
the nature of the injury is n't yet known , but northern ireland manager michael o'neill is expected to talk to the media later today .
he has called up former manchester united goalkeeper roy carroll , who now plays for linfield , as a replacement .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: darts : gorleston 's derry whitewashed by world champion
text: gorleston 's nathan derry was beaten 5-0 by world champion gary anderson on the second night of the grand slam of darts in wolverhampton .
the 29-year-old , nicknamed `` the firework '' , had won his opening match against alan norris after being given a wildcard into the event .
norwich 's darren webster lost 5-4 to darryl fitton .
he 's lost both of his matches and is bottom of his group .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: daisy the satellite swan touches down
text: the first of this season 's gps-tagged bewick 's swans has arrived back at welney for the winter .
daisy clarke touched down at the wildfowl and wetland trust 's reserve on the cambridgeshire-norfolk border last week .
she 'd made the journey across the north sea from the netherlands to take up her winter roost on the ouse washes , alongside almost 1,000 others which are permanent residents at the site .
daisy was first tagged in january 2015 .

documents.title: 'everyone is aware ' it 's dangerous to use mobiles behind the wheel
text: police say they 're abolishing the option for motorists to take part in a driver awareness course if they 're caught using a mobile phone behind the wheel , because `` everyone is aware it 's dangerous '' .

insp david giles from the serious collision investigation team said : `` it 's a conscious decision to do it - it 's not a momentary lapse of driving and careless driving when we try and improve driver behaviour through the courses .
`` this is a conscious decision , do i or do n't i use the phone ?
`` they 're taking the decision to use the phone so why should they be given a driver awareness course ?
author: Kelly McCormack
BBC Radio Suffolk

documents.title: second murder in norwich within eight days
text: a murder inquiry is under way in norwich following the death of a man at the weekend .
police were called to saffron square , in the mile cross area , at 07:00 on saturday , where they discovered the body of a man aged in his 50s .
a post-mortem examination found he had died from severe chest and facial injuries sustained from an assault .
the property remains sealed off , and norfolk police are appealing for anyone with information about the incident to contact them .
it 's the second murder in norwich within eight days .
on saturday , 5 november , 37-year-old steve stannard was stabbed at a property in bowers avenue , less than a mile away from saffron square .
police say they are not linking the two incidents .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hockey : harleston magpies stun league leaders
text: harleston magpies ladies became the first team to beat conference east leaders sevenoaks this season .
magpies beat the kent side 1-0 thanks to a goal from maria andrews after 42 minutes .
sevenoaks arrived at weybread having won all seven of their previous league matches this season .
the win means harleston are third in the table , just four points behind sevenoaks and wimbledon who are second .
ladies 1 result v @ twitterid fantastic flick save in the last moments by tosh
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: rugby : youngs says england need 'more discipline ' , despite win
text: norfolk 's ben youngs was named man of the match in england 's 37-21 victory over south africa at twickenham on saturday .
the leicester tigers scrum-half helped to inspire england 's 10th straight win under coach eddie jones .
youngs , who started his playing career at holt , admitted afterwards that england still have plenty of room for improvement .
`` coming into the game we were a bit nervous , we had n't played together for a while , '' he said .
`` in that first 20 minutes we 've got to be more disciplined . ''
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: second arrest in murder inquiry
text: a second man has been arrested in connection with the death of a man in norwich a week ago .
steve stannard , 37 , was found fatally stabbed in bowers avenue , in the mile cross area , at 14:30 on saturday , 5 november .
a man in his late teens was arrested in the croydon area at 23:00 on friday .
he was taken to wymondham police headquarters for questioning .
a 21-year-old man from london who had already been arrested in the connection with the murder inquiry was released on police bail until 10 january 2017 while inquiries continue .
anyone with information about the incident is asked to call norfolk police on 101 or contact crimestoppers anonymously .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live
